subject: Music
title: West Coast Jazz
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: West Coast Jazz.

hook.text: While New York played hot, California played cool â€” literally and musically.

buildup.text: West Coast jazz featured light tones, arranged charts, and a relaxed feel.

discovery.text: Chet Baker and Gerry Mulligan led a pianoless quartet that sounded like a whispered conversation.

twist.text: Critics dismissed it as white-washed jazz â€” but it influenced bossa nova and film scores.

climax.text: Its cool aesthetic shaped jazz's image for a generation of new listeners.

punchline.text: Not all jazz shouts. Some of the best jazz whispers.

quiz.question: What characterized West Coast jazz?
options: Light tones, arranged charts, and a relaxed feel
